Save your spot at our Ben Smith Fête before April 23 for special early bird pricing.

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

There’s just one day left to receive early bird pricing to our Ben Smith Fête next month — and I really hope you can be there.

From the ongoing impact of Trump’s family separation policy to the targeted destruction of Black churches — our rights, values and communities are literally coming under attack. Now more than ever, we need to come together to confront the forces of racism, division and hate — and demand a future of justice and liberty for all.

One way we can do that is to celebrate those who have been on the frontlines of this fight for generations. Our honoree this year, Sybil Haydel Morial, is one of those courageous people we’re recognizing at our Ben Smith Fête. Save your spot before April 23rd to receive special early bird pricing.

Ben Smith Fête

Join the ACLU of Louisiana to celebrate those who are leading liberty forward.

Thursday, May 23, 6 - 9 p.m.
Felicity Church
1220 Felicity St.
New Orleans, LA 70130

Purchase Tickets

Sybil, the wife of Dutch Morial, the first black mayor of New Orleans, Sybil is an accomplished freedom fighter in her own right: challenging segregation during Jim Crow and founding the Louisiana League of Good Government.

The Ben Smith Fête is also great opportunity to meet like-minded freedom fighters from around the state and celebrate our shared commitment to protecting the rights of every Louisianan. Proceeds from this event will fuel our work to challenge injustice and advocate for fairness and equality — in communities, in the State Capitol, and in court.

Thanks for all you do to defend freedom and justice in Louisiana.

We look forward to seeing you there,

ACLU of Louisiana
